alert.note: Alert for Northern Hancock; Northern Harrison; Pearl River (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 20 at 12:39PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Washington Parish, northwestern Harrison, northeastern Hancock and Pearl River Counties through 130 PM CDT... At 1239 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Varnado, or 8 miles south of Sandy Hook, moving southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Poplarville, Varnado, Saucier, Crossroads, Mcneil and Angie. This includes Interstate 59 in Mississippi between mile markers 13 and 33. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in New Orleans.

area.areaDesc: Northern Hancock; Northern Harrison; Pearl River
